lexUnit.name: polite.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: respectful and considerate of other people.

sentence.text: But I must say some of the American girls are slightly more polite …
In reality , the approach seemed more like a polite version of gate crashing .
Sir Wilfrid was more polite , but it was clear that he did not believe Mr Appin 's story .
Mrs Duffy left at once , but Clare felt it would be more polite to linger for a while , rather than rush out after the couple , as if the wedding had been an annoying chore .
He had barely addressed more than a few brief and studiously polite words to her -- and yet every fibre of her being was vibrantly aware of his magnetic , almost menacing presence .
` The lad asked a favour of an old shipmate , and being as he was most polite , how could that shipmate refuse , I ask you ?
` Not the most polite reception , " Joanna murmured .

Second , you can not storm barricades that are manned by people so polite they even congratulate Brian Redhead on his ` magnificent handling of this debate " ( particularly as Brian hardly said anything ) .
The French are not so polite as they were 15 years ago .
There were n't many people sitting near us , so I tried to make polite conversation , but he was n't having any .
` There 's no need to be so schoolgirlishly polite . "
Although the ministers were too polite to commit themselves , even when I pressed them on this point , it was clear to me that they felt they , and their church , had been used .
` She is too polite to bore us with a travelogue . "
She was plainly curious , but too polite to ask what was going on .
` She was n't very polite to me , you know . "
Not even very kind , very polite young men in her year at art school had so much as thawed one tiny corner of her iced-up emotions .
` He was one of the old breed , always quietly spoken and very polite to people .
There was polite applause as the mask came into view , and the performers settled .
Zimmerman walked out to polite applause from the few remaining guests .
Initially , they play great pop but halfway through the set explode into something far wilder , and the polite applause turns into cheers .
Polite letters of complaint get you nowhere .
After a while , Sky sent back a polite letter of rejection .
I have now received a polite letter from B.T. together with a phone card worth 30p .
With a polite smile , Victoria went back into the house and shut the door .
She plastered a polite smile on her face and turned the door-handle .
His polite smile did nothing to diminish the flat ultimatum in his eyes .
` I 've got an appointment , Griffin , so I have to go now , " Judy said in a polite voice .
` Are you mentally ill , sir ? " he said , in a small , polite voice .
` It 's not polite to say things like that , " said Alice .
` Jane , it is not polite to question me in that way .
But it seemed polite to visit the Freitas family , especially after Lina had come to Monte Samana on a fruitless errand .
The farmer 's wife invited us in and gave us cheesy , potato turnovers -- it would not be polite to refuse .
It seemed to her polite to do so .

Whenever I see coloured people in Porteneil , buying souvenirs or stopping off for a snack , I hope that they will ask me something so that I can show how polite I am and prove that my reasoning is stronger than my more crass instincts , or training .
GERMANS are not often polite about British managers .
She was polite about the leeks and lumpy cheese and said a similar thing could be done with endives and it looked at first as if the lunch was going to prove a slightly awkward affair .
I am being polite about the way in which the Government have behaved when I say that they have dealt with our recommendations in a cavalier fashion .
` None of which has any relevance to you , " said the woman , ` but it 's nice and polite of you to listen . "
It enabled him to ask the bluntest of questions in the politest of tones and to disguise his opinion behind the blandest of smiles .
It was n't polite of them not to answer the door , knowing that he was standing there , but it did n't really matter .
When they visit I expect my husband to be polite to them .
Annabel Hogan was polite to him even if her maid was n't .
He has been polite to Paul all along .
We are vague and polite with one another .
To keep my distance from everybody , always being a polite child , I became an unusually polite teenager .
She brought from under her shawl an untidy sheaf of documents and handed them to Emily without so much as bobbing a polite curtsy .
` That was n't a true or polite thing to say .
The Danish eluded her but the tone of voice nearer a growl than a polite question suggested she was being asked to state her business .
But Doreen retained the sulkiness she 'd brought to the table , and when Jean placed fruit and cereal before her there was not the slightest sign of a polite thank-you .
All she 'd done was to make a bit of polite conversation !
The response was coldly polite .
In the kitchen she found Ling busily filling the two food hampers , but when she offered to help his refusal was firm but polite .
He was charming and witty , but , although Caroline was polite , she offered no encouragement .
